OOC: Sorry I haven't posted lately. Just got out of the hospital. But 
I'm feeling much better now. 

IC:
Wolfblade:
She took the drink and downed it. She didn't budge. Didn't even 
twitch. However, she couldn't move to save her life. She smiled 
slightly and looked at him. He was spiking her drinks and she was 
just now realizing it. She was mad at him for now her motor skills 
went into stasis for a  bit. She took a deep breath and looked at 
him. "Malice, I like you. You are a good comrad in arms. However, you 
ever...and I mean EVER do that again, and once I can move again I'll 
terminate your programs perminantely." She couldn't help but chuckle. 
He got the better side of her and she was more frustrated at herself 
for letting her guard down.



--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, robert riley <bustercross365@y...> 
wrote:
> Malice chuckled.  He mixed up another drink for himself and 
Wolfblade.  He added more energy and created an additional waveform.
> <Let's see now, what system to target?  Hmm, nothing 
interconnected.  I know!  Her minor motor control!  We'll see how 
badly her eyes and tail twitch now!>
> He introduced the waveform, added the energon, and put a little 
Russian Vodka in as a kicker.
> "Dare to try?"
> He downed his, with no problem, and watched Wolfblade with great 
interest.
> 
> shadowess_azogoth <shadowess_azogoth@y...> wrote:
> OOC: Disregard last post.  My comp is giving me fits and I typed 
the 
> post under the wrong name. it's supposed to be Wolfblade. Let me 
> please repost.
> 
> IC:
> Wolfblade::
> She was starting to feel her legs again. Just to be sure, she stood 
> up and and walked around the room. Her body was now normal. She sat 
> back down and looked at the glass again. She drank it down and 
> smiled. "THat wasn't so....." Her smile disappeared as sparks lept 
> from her neck and wrists. Her tail twitched wildly and her optics 
> flashed wildly in various colors.  She twitched and sputtered a 
bit. 
> After a few seconds, her body returned to normal. With a little 
mech 
> fluid leaking from her nose and ears, she grinned. "Ah, finally. 
> something with a kick."  She looked at her empty glass. "Got 
another 
> one?"
> 
>
